sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"协定，协议，契约，合同"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: agreement, contract, treaty, convention, bargain, understanding, accord
means: agreement ：普通用词，含义最确定，泛指个人、团体或国家之间取得一致而达成的任何协议、协定或合同、契约等，可以是口头的，也可以是书面的。
contract ：侧重指双方或多方订立的具有法律效力的正式的书面合同或契约。
treaty ：指国家之间经外交谈判后依照国际法签订的正式条约。
convention ：比treaty更专门化，但不及treaty正式。也可指国家之间就有关事情签订的条约。
bargain ：通常指商业交往中的购销合同。
understanding ：指不具约束力的非正式的协议。
accord ：多指国际间的非正式协议。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"贸易，交易"之意。
means: business ： 指包括售货、购货、换货在内的综合商业活动，方式可以是批发或零售。
commerce ： 多指大规模的买卖或易货关系。
trade ： 普通用词，含义广。既可指某种具体的商业又可指广泛的贸易。
bargain ： 多指买卖双方通过谈判、协商就商品质量、数量、价格等项达成协议所成的生意。
deal ： 口语用词，指买卖双方经过交涉达成协议成交。

sentence.Network_en: They prefer to bargain with individual clients, for cash.
sentence.Network_cn: 在现款方面，他们更愿意同散户打交道。

sentence.Network_en: They need hostages in order to bargain with the government.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们要想同政府讨价还价就得有人质。

sentence.Network_en: Fresh salmon is a bargain at the supermarket this week.
sentence.Network_cn: 这周超市的新鲜鲑鱼特价销售。

jx.jx_en_mean: be uncompromising in making a deal
in addition to what has been already mentioned or was expected

lj.lj_ly: I am now tired and extremely hungry—with a headache into the bargain.
lj.lj_ls: 我现在又累又饿，而且还头疼。

phrase.cizu_name: keep one's side of the bargain

jx.jx_en_mean: carry out the promises one has made as part of an agreement

lj.lj_ly: “I never bargained for this tearing feeling inside me”(&b{Anne Tyler})
lj.lj_ls: “我从来没想到自己内心有如此激烈的感情”(&b{安妮·泰勒})

jx.jx_en_mean: Over and above what is expected; in addition.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 出乎意料：超出、超过了期望值；另外

phrase.cizu_name: into the bargain 或 in the bargain

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from Old French bargaine (noun), bargaignier (verb); probably of Germanic origin and related to German borgen 'borrow'

encyclopedia.content: 《Bargain》是一款日本时尚杂志。 杂志简介 《Bargain》是一份经典畅销的时尚女性名牌包袋配饰杂志。从时尚女装到时尚女鞋，从精美彩妆到精致女包，配五彩缤纷的女性饰品。其中以名牌包袋为主，介绍各类时尚品牌与时尚搭配潮流。深受时尚人士及爱包一族的青睐。 《越狱》第四季提到的秘密文件关键内容 Bargain这个单词原意为交易或协议，但是在越狱第四季中主角Michael Scofield在做脑部手术时进入了自己的思维（貌似回忆但不全是

entry.def: Something that is a bargain is good value for money, usually because it has been sold at a lower price than normal.

example.ex: At this price the wine is a bargain...
example.tran: 这种葡萄酒卖这个价真是很便宜。

example.ex: Fresh salmon is a bargain at the supermarket this week.
example.tran: 这周超市的新鲜鲑鱼特价销售。

entry.def: A bargain is an agreement, especially a formal business agreement, in which two people or groups agree what each of them will do, pay, or receive.

example.ex: I'll make a bargain with you. I'll play hostess if you'll include Matthew in your guest-list...
example.tran: 我们说定了，如果你能把马修也邀请来的话我就做东。

example.ex: The treaty was based on a bargain between the French and German governments.
example.tran: 这个条约是以法国和德国政府之间的一个协议为基础的。

entry.tran: 商谈；交涉；谈判；讨价还价
entry.def: When people bargain with each other, they discuss what each of them will do, pay, or receive.

example.ex: They prefer to bargain with individual clients, for cash...
example.tran: 在现款方面，他们更愿意同散户打交道。

example.ex: Shop in small local markets and don't be afraid to bargain.
example.tran: 在当地的小店购物，不要害怕砍价。

entry.tran: 极力讨价还价；提出苛刻的交易条件
entry.def: If people drive a hard bargain, they argue with determination in order to achieve a deal which is favourable to themselves.

example.ex: ...a law firm with a reputation for driving a hard bargain.
example.tran: 在讲价方面颇有名气的律师事务所

entry.def: You use into the bargain when mentioning an additional quantity, feature, fact, or action, to emphasize the fact that it is also involved. You can also say in the bargain in American English.

example.ex: This machine is designed to save you effort, and keep your work surfaces tidy into the bargain...
example.tran: 这种机器既省力，又能保持工作台面的整洁。

example.ex: She is rich. Now you say she is a beauty into the bargain.
example.tran: 她很有钱。现在你又说她还是个美女。

entry.def: If you keep your side of the bargain, you do what you have promised or arranged to do.

example.ex: Dealing with this dictator wasn't an option. He wouldn't have kept his side of the bargain.
example.tran: 别跟这个独裁者打交道，他不会信守诺言的。

means.word_mean: 1. an agreement between parties (usually arrived at after discussion) fixing obligations of each;

sentences.sentence: "he made a bargain with the devil"
"he rose to prominence through a series of shady deals"
"she got a bargain at the auction"
"the stock was a real buy at that price"

means.word_mean: 1. negotiate the terms of an exchange;

sentences.sentence: "We bargained for a beautiful rug in the bazaar"

means.word_mean: 2. come to terms; arrive at an agreement

auth_sentence.content: The dollar might be the biggest investment bargain going.
auth_sentence.res_content: The dollar might be the biggest investment bargain going.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The dollar might be the biggest investment bargain going.

auth_sentence.content: We will not bargain on our freedom and independence.
auth_sentence.res_content: We will not bargain on our freedom and independence.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We will not bargain on our freedom and independence.

auth_sentence.content: The remainder is sold a bargain basement prices.
auth_sentence.res_content: The remainder is sold a bargain basement prices.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The remainder is sold a bargain basement prices.

Sentence.sentence: She left her work early to get some bargains last Saturday.
The woman is very good at bargaining.

means.word_mean: 讨价还价; 商谈，商讨条件

sentences.en: In some shops you have to bargain.
sentences.cn: 在一些商店中买东西要讲价。

means.word_mean: 提出条件; 要求得到

sentences.en: We bargained a new wage increase.
sentences.cn: 我们达成了增加工资的新协议。

jushi.english: These shoes are a real bargain at such a low price.
jushi.chinese: 这些鞋价钱这么低,确实便宜。

jushi.english: The book is real bargain at two yuan .
jushi.chinese: 那本书定价二元是够便宜的。

jushi.english: If you promote our goods, we will give a good discount as our part of the bargain.
jushi.chinese: 若你方经销我们的货物,我方愿给予你相当大的优惠作为回报。
